bibl.title: Letter, Southgate Cregmile in Murfreesboro, Tenn. to Mother, 1863, May 3
bibl.note: 1863 May 3 Southgate Cregmile in Murfreesboro, Tenn., to his Mother (Eleanor Griffin). Updates her on the well being of the hometown boys. On constant watch for Conf. Gen. Bragg to show up there at any time. Describes the forfeiture of weapons and surrender of hundreds of Rebel soldiers due to lack of rations, including one whole division. Union Com. Rosencrans (Old Rosey), preparing to move forward, orders the men to exchange their large tents for small, so they can be carried. Urges her to write soon.

div.p: I seat my self this after noon to rite you a few lines to let you know how things is going on at this place

Harvey cone has gone to the hospital. all the rest of the Reily boys is well. we are looking for Bragg here every day while I were on Picket the other night there were tow hundred rebles stacked there arms out side of the picket and come in and give them selves up. thay say Bragg whle army only has
six days rashions and doent know where the next is to come from thay sad there whole Division was coming in the first chance thay got. James Rea got a Butternut letter from Jr. McCluskey.

Old Rosey is fixen for a forward movement we have turnde over our large tents and have drawed small tents so that we can care them with us. I will send you some of our small change that we get here no more at presant
